LLM Token Processing Visualization

Understanding how "favourable food of the cat is" becomes a prediction

Processing Pipeline

Step 1: Tokenization

Input: "favourable food of the cat is"
Tokens: ["favour", "able", " food", " of", " the", " cat", " is"]
↓

Step 2: Token IDs

Tokens → Numeric IDs:
[8421, 1234, 2847, 1023, 5643, 3829, 1547]
↓

Step 3: Embeddings

Each ID → 768-dim vector:
"cat" → [0.21, -0.45, 0.78, ...]
"food" → [0.15, -0.32, 0.61, ...]
↓

Step 4: Contextual Processing

Multi-head self-attention:
- "cat" attends to "food"
- Relationships strengthened
- 12-96 transformer layers
↓

Step 5: Vector Search

Find nearby vectors in space:
- Words semantically close to "cat"
- Words related to "food"
- Context: "is" (predicting next token)
↓

Step 6: Probability Distribution

Output probabilities:
"fish" → 35% ████████████
"meat" → 20% ███████
"tuna" → 15% █████

Cosine Similarity Formula

similarity = (A · B) / (||A|| × ||B||)
Range: -1 (opposite) to +1 (identical)

Measures the angle between two vectors. Close vectors (similar meaning) have high cosine similarity.
